statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Towson wins 84-58 over N.C. A&T
article.description: — Christian May had 15 points in Towson's 84-58 victory against N.C. A&T on Thursday night.
article.story: GREENSBORO, N.C. -- — Christian May had 15 points in Towson's 84-58 victory against N.C. A&T on Thursday night. May had five rebounds for the Tigers (18-12, 11-6 Coastal Athletic Association). Nendah Tarke scored 12 points and added 10 rebounds, five assists, and three blocks. Messiah Jones was 4 of 6 shooting and 2 of 4 from the free throw line to finish with 11 points. The Aggies (7-23, 5-12) were led in scoring by Jalal McKie, who finished with 16 points. Landon Glasper added 11 points for N.C. A&T. In addition, Camian Shell had 10 points and three steals. The Aggies prolonged their losing streak to eight straight. Towson took the lead with 13:38 remaining in the first half and did not give it up. The score was 42-21 at halftime, with Jones racking up eight points. Towson outscored N.C. A&T in the second half by five points, with May scoring a team-high seven points after intermission. Both teams play again on Saturday. Towson visits UNC Wilmington and N.C. A&T travels to play Campbell. ------ The Associated Press created this story using technology provided by Data Skrive and data from Sportradar.
